intro: Pentanema indicum var. hypoleucum, commonly known as the white-flowered pentanema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded forest understories. This variant is distinguished by its reduced floral coloration compared to the typical form of Pentanema indicum.
